version_description: Diese aktualisierte Version enthält Fehlerkorrekturen und Funktionsverbesserungen. Falls du Ideen oder Fragen für uns hast, schick uns bitte eine E-Mail an mobile-feedback@redbubble.com. Vielen Dank!
Diese aktualisierte Version enthält Fehlerkorrekturen und Funktionsverbesserungen. Falls du Ideen oder Fragen für uns hast, schick uns bitte eine E-Mail an mobile-feedback@redbubble.com. Vielen Dank!

More art is good. Previously, when you checked out artists’ shops, you’d see up to 15 works. Well, phooey to that. Because in this update, you’ll now find more art than you can shake a thing that you would shake at art. That means you’ll see all the artists’ works. We really have a tendency to overcomplicate things, don't we?

iPhone X is go. For those lucky ones who pre-ordered the iPhone X, you can continue using the Redbubble App. It's now fully supported. Digital dreams do come true.

Bugs be gone. We also fixed some bugs and stuff. Don’t really have anything clever to say about that. It’s just good that we did it.

More art is good. Previously, when you checked out artists’ shops, you’d see up to 15 works. Well, phooey to that. Because in this update, you’ll now find more art than you can shake a thing that you would shake at art. That means you’ll see all the artists’ works. We really have a tendency to overcomplicate things, don't we?

iPhone X is go. For those lucky ones who pre-ordered the iPhone X, you can continue using the Redbubble App. It's now fully supported. Digital dreams do come true.

Bugs be gone. We also fixed some bugs and stuff. Don’t really have anything clever to say about that. It’s just good that we did it.
This update contains bug fixed and feature improvements. If you have any feedback, please email mobile-feedback@redbubble.com

Jingle app, jingle app
Jingle all the way
Oh what fun it is to make
Our app icon look all Christmasy and stuff

Jingle app, jingle app
Jingle all the way
Oh what fun it is to make
Our app icon look all Christmasy and stuff

Save a fave and we sync your saves.

In this update, if you favourite a design on the website, you'll now see it in the app. Fave one on the app, you'll see it on the site. It’s the harmonious yin and yang of seeing stuff you like in all your Redbubble viewing places. Also, it’s super sweet. All you need to do is login with your Redbubble account. Don’t have an account? No sweat. Just sign up. It’s like the easiest thing to ever easy.

We have heard your calls for help, and have returned with a can of hairspray and a lighter to torch these bugs!
Bug fixes and UI improvements across the app.
Also, if you're wondering, at Redbubble we care deeply about the ozone layer and are using an organic non-CFC hairspray for our QA process.
Got feedback? Email mobile-feedback@redbubble.com

Hey there. We know you’re probably busy. So we just have a few things.

- Artist profiles are looking as sharp as a very sharp item. Like scissors or a letter opener or something. But they’re not dangerous. Well, some could be. But not physically dangerous. Just “dangerous” in that “edgy art” kind of way. So don’t worry.

- When you find something you love in an artist's shop, you’ll find more somethings to love thanks to the “More Like This” panel. Which is very nice. Because the world could always use more love, right? Awwwww.

- Remember what we said about the “sharp” artist profiles like, two seconds ago? Well, the same could be said for delivery dates. Because we made those look better too. So please refer to that update, but exchange “artist profiles” for “delivery dates” and you'll be sufficiently updated. Thanks for not making us type that again.

- Plus, we squashed some bugs. Bugs are dumb. Now they’re gone. ‘nuff said.

Break out your crystal balls, tarot cards, and/or other prognosticating devises of your choice. This latest update looks to both the past and future of searching for stuff in the Redbubble app.

Past: See your search history when you tap the search bar. Now you don’t have to try to remember that awesome thing you searched for in the middle of the night after waking up in a cold sweat. The app’s got you covered.

Future: Start typing a thing into the search bar and recommendations for designs featuring that thing will pop up for your clicking and browsing pleasure.

Present: We killed some bugs. So techincally those bugs are in the past, but their deadness is in the present. We think. Either way, smell ya later, bugs.

Got feedback? Email mobile-feedback@redbubble.com

Past: See your search history when you tap the search bar. Now you don’t have to try to remember that awesome thing you searched for in the middle of the night after waking up in a cold sweat. The app’s got you covered.

Future: Start typing a thing into the search bar and recommendations for designs featuring that thing will pop up for your clicking and browsing pleasure.

Present: We killed some bugs. So techincally those bugs are in the past, but their deadness is in the present. We think. Either way, smell ya later, bugs.

Got feedback? Email mobile-feedback@redbubble.com

We squashed some bugs. Or if bug squashing makes you sad even in metaphors, imagine that we carefully put our app bugs under a cup and brought them safely outside (idk where that is in the app dimension though). Point is, pesky connection errors, creepy crawly login failures, and other minor bugs have all been flushed down the toilet / are happily thriving where they belong outdoors. Internet outdoors.

Metaphors are hard.

Additionally, our new launch screen features the bonkers-town great artwork, "Gilgamesh" by Adam Priestler. You really should see it, because we don't say "bonkers-town" lightly.

Got feedback? Email mobile-feedback@redbubble.com

We like our explore feed like we like our ice cream: fast and unlimited. So we updated our app. Now our explore feed loads quicker than ever and it won't run out of cool art.
(Our app is also better than ice cream in that it won't melt and is lactose free. We're pretty sure.)

Bugs have also been mercilessly squashed. Sorry, little guys.
Our new splash screen is "Moon Ride" by buko

Good news. We released a bunch of spiders into our app to get rid of bugs. Hopefully our app likes being filled with spiders. Guess we'll find out. Stay tuned.
We've also got new launch screen artwork: "Soft Serve" by crispe. It's pretty cool.

We've also got new launch screen artwork: "Soft Serve" by crispe. It's pretty cool.

It's update time again, baby! (Sorry, that was weird). The engineering team said we changed up our app, "to provide support for upcoming product releases." IDK exactly what that means, but it sounds nice that our app is supportive now. Good job, app. Way to be the change. I'm sure the "upcoming product releases" appreciate it more than you know.

It's update time again, baby! (Sorry, that was weird). The engineering team said we changed up our app, "to provide support for upcoming product releases." IDK exactly what that means, but it sounds nice that our app is supportive now. Good job, app. Way to be the change. I'm sure the "upcoming product releases" appreciate it more than you know.

Hey there app release notes fans. So we’ve been doing a bunch of behind-the-scenes work on our app here. What kind of work? The invisible kind. But the invisible kind that makes your shopping cart and checkout experiences way better. It's like what dear sweet mama always says, "Better stuff is always better than worse stuff. Especially when we're talkin' about app updates." Mama digs tech.

We also launched a new launch screen called "Red Moon" by Leire Bueno. Launch. Moon. Get it? Ugh.

Raise your hand if you like history.
Did you raise it.
Just realized we can’t see you.
Crud.
This was a bad way to start the update.
Sigh.
Okay. Let’s just move on to the release notes and assume that history bit was going to pay off in a hilarious and satisfying way. Cool? Cool.
(Makes note to figure out how to see app release note readers when raising hands in the future.)

Here we go:

You can now see everything you’ve ordered in your account. So it’s easy to relive (and hopefully not regret) all your past purchases in one handy place.

Speaking of one handy place, your carts will now sync between the website and app.

We’ve dropped support for iOS 10 to fully support iOS 11 and 12. It’s all about the latest and greatest ‘round here.

Speaking of iOS 12, you can now autofill your passwords. So that's one less thing to remember. Or is it one fewer thing to remember? Hm. No way to ever find out.

Want to see how those iPhone cases and floor pillows you’ve been browsing will look IRL? Now you can with some sweet, sweet 3D and AR models. It’s pretty fancy. For real.

We’ve got new launch screen art called “The Jungle” by Jack Teagle. You’re WELCOME to check it out. Get it? Of course you do. Because that was a terrible and obvious joke.

Sigh again.

Crud.

Sigh.

(Makes note to figure out how to see app release note readers when raising hands in the future.)

Sigh again.

Oh boy. Hot n' fresh app improvements comin at ya. Hope you're hungry. And that you eat apps I guess.
Updates:
-Removing items from your cart is easier than ever.
-You'll get push notifications when your stuff has been shipped.
-We've squashed some bugs.
-There's a sweet new launch screen up: "Pom Poms and Fairy Lights" by beckygarratt.

Oh boy. Hot n' fresh app improvements comin at ya. Hope you're hungry. And that you eat apps I guess.
Updates:
-Removing items from your cart is easier than ever.
-You'll get push notifications when your stuff has been shipped.
-We've squashed some bugs.
-There's a sweet new launch screen up: "Pom Poms and Fairy Lights" by beckygarratt.

Software engineer Craig said he’d cry if we didn’t do a good job on these app release notes. So please, for Craig’s sake, enjoy them.

Don’t fret, fair Craig:

Higher quality artwork: Do you like artwork? What about artwork that looks really good? What about artwork that looks really, really good? If you said yes, then this app update is the app update of your app update dreams. Because there’s higher quality imagery on artwork pages now. So fans of high quality things, break out your (probably) high quality trumpets and wail away like you’ve never wailed away before.

Spread the word: Love an artist’s work? You can now share links to their shops with all of your friends, Romans, and/or countrymen. Or anybody, really. That’s the point. No idea why we got all Shakespeare-y. Won’t happen again.

Bugs got squashed: We squashed bugs. We’re good at squashing bugs. So we squashed ‘em good.

And that's it. Hope you (and Craig) enjoyed these. Until next time, app update fans.

Good news. Our robot overlords swooped in and fine-tuned our app. And boy howdy, did they make some solid updates.

While our flimsy human brains aren't totally capable of understanding exactly what these superior beings did, we DO know they've made searching for stuff a lot easier. They've also added artist spotlights, topic recommendations, and comfy new throw blankets to the app.

Thanks, robots.

New launch screen: "Transdimensional space goat" by jolenecasko

As the poet Lord Tennyson once famously said, "We've updated our app to include new products, user improvements, and other cool stuff." Truly ahead of his time.
Here are the details:

- You can now shop for awesome art-covered shower curtains, bath mats, transparent stickers, and glossy stickers on the app.
- We've improved our sign up and login experience.
- There's sweet new art on the launch screen: "Let Me Free" by vanshocker.

Surprise. Well, not so much - this happens all the time. We’ve got a couple of quick app updates for you today.

- First up, we’ve added everything you would need to shop for some exciting new products… just in case.
- Next, tell us your favorite color? Stop, no, don’t say anything. Just use the new color picker for Apparel and pick for yourself. You’ll never see black again, unless you want that. Then that’s easy too.

As always, we’ve got a shiny new launch screen "Lights" by yurishwedoff.

Know what happens if you don't update your app? Your phone gets sulky. And sulky phones take unflattering photos. They misspell "their." They butt-dial moms. Don't risk it.
Update this app for size picker improvements, a better product page, bug fixes, and a new launch screen: Salad Days by Totis Raphael.

- We've also squashed some bugs.

We squashed some bugs. Or if bug squashing makes you sad even in metaphors, imagine that we carefully put our app bugs under a cup and brought them safely outside (idk where that is in the app dimension though). Point is, the bugs have all been flushed down the toilet / are happily thriving where they belong outdoors. Internet outdoors.

Metaphors are hard.

Plus, we’ve got a new design on the launch screen called "Falling Softly" by Evelina Kremsdorf.
